intro: Leersia oryzoides f. glabra, commonly known as smooth leersia, is a variant of the leersia species characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves. It is a perennial grass native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spikelet cluster, bearing small, two-ranked flowers. This grass is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
